The first to hear the Dharma in Jambudvīpa.

original: 於未來世值遇賢劫一切諸佛。
analyzed: 於未來世值遇賢劫一切諸佛。

Those who are able to offer a single harītakī fruit,
with a sincere and pure mind, to the Sangha,
will definitely not encounter the calamity of pestilence.
Those who are able to give a single ball of food to sentient beings,
will definitely not encounter the calamity of famine.
The two continents of the east and west do not have the three fundamental calamities,
but they do have three similar calamities.
That is to say, when malice increases, it is similar to warfare.
When the body is weak, it is similar to pestilence.
When hunger and thirst increase frequently, it is similar to famine.

original: 北洲根本相似俱無新婆沙論三災起時復有三種最極衰損。
analyzed: 北洲根本相似俱無新婆沙論三災起時復有三種最極衰損。

First, lifespan.

Second, the basis.
That is, the body size is at most one cubit.
Third, resources.
That is, millet and barnyard grass are considered the best food.
Hair is considered the best clothing.

One person is one foot.
One Buddha is two feet.
The great calamities.

analyzed: 一大劫終必一火災起如前賢劫成住壞空八十小劫。

translated: Are one great eon. Thus, after seven great eons, there are seven fire calamities.
In total, the first dhyāna is destroyed seven times.
Again, after one great eon.
There is one water calamity that arises.

original: 壞至二禪。🔽如是七七火災。
analyzed: 壞至二禪。 如是七七火災。
translated: It destroys up to the second dhyāna.🔽Thus, after seven times seven fire calamities.
Intermittently, there are seven water calamities.
After that, there are seven fire calamities.
In total, there are fifty-six times of fire destroying the first dhyāna heaven.
Seven times of water destroying the second dhyāna heaven.
After that, there is one great eon.
There is one wind calamity that arises.
In total, it is sixty-four great eons.

original: 為大三災始終之相依俱舍論出義。
analyzed: 為大三災始終之相依俱舍論出義。
translated: This is the beginning and end of the three great calamities according to the Abhidharma-kośa.
First, the fire calamity destroys the first dhyāna heaven.

original: 災欲起時地獄罪畢來生人中。
analyzed: 災欲起時地獄罪畢來生人中。
translated: When the calamity is about to arise, the sinners in hell finish their retribution and are reborn among humans.

original: 有定業者轉生他方地獄。
analyzed: 有定業者轉生他方地獄。
translated: Those with fixed karma are reborn in the hells of other directions.
In the end, there is not a single sentient being.
This is called the destruction of hell.

original: 畜生餓鬼阿修羅亦次第盡。
analyzed: 畜生餓鬼阿修羅亦次第盡。
translated: Animals, hungry ghosts, and asuras are also exhausted in sequence.
At that time, the world all practices the ten wholesome deeds.
There are no worms in the human body.
It is the same as the Buddha's body.
This is because at that time the animals are destroyed.

original: 時此南洲一人無師自然得初靜慮初禪也從靜慮起唱言離生喜樂甚樂甚靜。

translated: At that time, a person in this southern continent, without a teacher, naturally attains the first meditative absorption (first dhyāna). The other people, having heard this, all enter meditative absorption.
When their lives end, they all attain rebirth in the Brahma world.
The two continents in the east and west should be explained in the same way.
The faculties of the people in the northern continent are dull and lack the mindfulness to become free from desire.
When their lives end, they are reborn in the heavens of the desire realm.
Only after the meditative absorption manifests can they become free from desire.
Until there is not a single sentient being left in the human realm,
it is called the destruction of the human realm.
At that time, the six heavens of the desire realm,
one heaven naturally attains the first meditative absorption.
Until all attain rebirth in the Brahma world,
it is called the destruction of the desire realm.

original: 時梵世中一天自然得二靜慮二禪也唱言定生喜樂甚樂甚靜。
analyzed: 時梵世中一天自然得二靜慮二禪也唱言定生喜樂甚樂甚靜。
translated: At that time, in the Brahma world, one heaven naturally attains the second meditative absorption, and proclaims, The joy and bliss born of concentration is very blissful and very tranquil!
The other heavens, having heard this, all enter meditative absorption.
When their lives end, they all attain rebirth in the Ābhāsvara heaven.

original: 乃至梵世大梵天也已壞。
analyzed: 乃至梵世大梵天也已壞。
translated: Until the Brahma world, up to the Mahā-brahmā heaven, is destroyed.
Beginning from the hells and ending with the Brahma heaven,
there are nineteen increases and decreases.
The sentient world is destroyed in sequence.
Only the empty and desolate world remains.

original: 乃至三千三界一切有情同業壞盡。
analyzed: 乃至三千三界一切有情同業壞盡。
translated: Until the same karma of all beings in the three thousand three realms is exhausted,

original: 最後一增減劫方壞器世間。
analyzed: 最後一增減劫方壞器世間。
translated: The last increase and decrease of the eon will destroy the world.
Here, there are gradually seven suns appearing.

original: 有大黑風吹海水為兩披。
analyzed: 有大黑風吹海水為兩披。
translated: A great black wind blows the seawater apart.

original: 初取一日置須彌腹日道中行。
analyzed: 初取一日置須彌腹日道中行。
translated: First, it takes one sun and places it in the path of the sun in the belly of Mount Sumeru.
The grass and trees wither.
Next, it takes two suns.
The rivers and canals all dry up.
The seawater gradually dries up by seven hundred yojanas.
When the third sun appears,
The Ganges River dries up together.
When the fourth sun appears,
The Anavatapta Lake dries up.
When the fifth sun appears,

original: 四大海水七千由旬一時竭盡。
analyzed: 四大海水七千由旬一時竭盡。
translated: The four great seas of seven thousand yojanas dry up all at once.
When the sixth sun appears,
The earth catches fire and is burned to destruction.

original: 七日出時須彌山壞眾山洞然。
analyzed: 七日出時須彌山壞眾山洞然。
translated: When the seventh sun appears, Mount Sumeru is destroyed and the mountains burn through.
The wind blows the raging flames to burn the heavenly palaces above.
Up to the Brahma Heaven, there is no ash or embers left.
The flames of one's own realm burn one's own palace.
The calamities of other realms cannot destroy other realms.
Because they cause each other to arise, it is said that they burn above.
Starting from the hells up to the Brahma Heaven,
in one increase and decrease kalpa, they are destroyed in sequence.

original: 乃至三千世界一時俱壞。
analyzed: 乃至三千世界一時俱壞。
translated: Up to the time when the three thousand worlds are destroyed together.
This is called the destruction by fire.
After the fire calamity of the first dhyāna passes,
the world is empty like a dark cave.
For a long time of twenty increase and decrease kalpas,
a great cloud rains and the water rises to the heavens.
The wind blows the water foam to form the palace of the Brahma Heaven.

original: 如是下至地獄如前建立在前成劫說。
analyzed: 如是下至地獄如前建立在前成劫說。
translated: In this way, down to the hells, as established before, it is explained in the previous formation kalpa.
Miscellaneous from the Chang Ahan Sutra.
The Sutra of the Root of Existence.

original: 雜心論。🔽顯宗論。🔽順正理論。
analyzed: 雜心論。 顯宗論。 順正理論。
translated: The Saṃyuktâbhidharmahṛdaya.🔽The Abhidharma-nyāyânusāra-śāstra.🔽The Abhidharma-nyāyânusāra-śāstra.
The Yogācārabhūmi-śāstra.
Next, the water calamity destroys the second dhyāna.
When this calamity arises,

original: 地獄餓鬼旁生四洲人趣六欲諸天。
analyzed: 地獄餓鬼旁生四洲人趣六欲諸天。
translated: The hells, hungry ghosts, animals, the four continents, the human realm, and the six desire heavens.
In succession, they are reborn in the second dhyana heaven.
In the second dhyana heaven, there is a god.
Naturally attaining the samadhi of the third dhyana.
The other gods hear of it.
All enter this samadhi and are reborn in the third dhyana.

original: 是時二禪中有俱生水界起壞器世間。
analyzed: 是時二禪中有俱生水界起壞器世間。
translated: At this time, in the second dhyana heaven, the innate water element arises and destroys the world of the container.
Just like water dissolving salt.

original: 一時俱沒有說從三禪邊空中。
analyzed: 一時俱沒有說從三禪邊空中。
translated: At the same time, they all disappear. It is said that from the edge of the third dhyana, in the empty space,
Suddenly, hot ashes and water rain down.

original: 有說從下水輪涌水上騰是為水災壞二禪。
analyzed: 有說從下水輪涌水上騰是為水災壞二禪。
translated: Some say that from the lower water wheel, the water surges up and rises. This is called the water calamity that destroys the second dhyana.
After the water calamity passes,
Like before, there are twenty small eons of emptiness.
Like before, the great clouds bring down rain.
The wind blows the water bubbles to form the palaces of the light sound heaven.
Below, after the hells are formed,
The third wind calamity destroys the third dhyana.
When the calamity arises,

original: 下地諸趣有情及六欲二禪。
analyzed: 下地諸趣有情及六欲二禪。
translated: The beings in the lower realms and the six desires and second dhyana heaven,
In succession, are reborn in the third dhyana.
At that time, a god
Naturally attained the four dhyāna concentrations.
The other gods heard of this
And all entered this concentration, attaining rebirth in the fourth dhyāna.

original: 是時三禪中有俱生風界起。
analyzed: 是時三禪中有俱生風界起。
translated: At that time, in the third dhyāna realm, the innate wind element arose,
Destroying the world of the vessel.
Blowing the heavenly palaces, they smashed into powder.
The great mountains were also smashed to pieces.
Like wind drying the limbs, all were exhausted.
This is called the wind calamity destroying the third dhyāna realm. Some say

original: 從四禪邊歘然風起飄擊。
analyzed: 從四禪邊歘然風起飄擊。
translated: From the edge of the fourth dhyāna, the wind suddenly arose, blowing and striking.
Some say

original: 從下風輪擊風上騰○出順正理論。
analyzed: 從下風輪擊風上騰○出順正理論。
translated: From the lower wind wheel, the wind struck, rising up. - From the Nyāyānusāra-śāstra.

original: 瑜伽對法論如是東方無量世界。🔽或有將壞。
analyzed: 瑜伽對法論如是東方無量世界。 或有將壞。
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi-śāstra says: In this way, in the innumerable worlds of the east,🔽Some are about to be destroyed,

analyzed: 或有將成。 或有正壞。
translated: Some are about to be formed,🔽Some are being destroyed,
Some are empty after being destroyed,
Some are being formed,
Some remain after being formed.

original: 乃至十方亦爾。🔽若有情世間。
analyzed: 乃至十方亦爾。 若有情世間。
translated: The same is true in the ten directions.🔽If it is the world of sentient beings,
Or the world of the vessel,
Because it is produced by the power of karma and afflictions.

original: 業煩惱增上力所起故瑜伽對法論初禪內有覺觀火擾亂故。
analyzed: 業煩惱增上力所起故瑜伽對法論初禪內有覺觀火擾亂故。
translated: Because it arises from the dominant power of karma and afflictions. The Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra and Abhidharma-mahāvibhāṣā-śāstra say that in the first dhyāna, there is the fire of coarse and fine investigation internally, which disturbs and agitates,
so externally it is burned by the calamity of fire.
In the second dhyāna, there is the water of joy internally, which disturbs and agitates,
so externally it is carried away by the calamity of water.

original: 三禪內有出入息風擾亂故。
analyzed: 三禪內有出入息風擾亂故。
translated: In the third dhyāna, there is the wind of inhalation and exhalation internally, which disturbs and agitates,
so externally it is destroyed by the calamity of wind.

original: 四禪不定相續隨彼天生宮殿俱起。
analyzed: 四禪不定相續隨彼天生宮殿俱起。
translated: In the fourth dhyāna, the appearance is indefinite. The palaces arise together with the birth of the gods there.

original: 若天命終宮殿亦沒雜心論。
analyzed: 若天命終宮殿亦沒雜心論。
translated: If the gods' lives end, the palaces also disappear.

original: 四禪內外過患一切皆無涅槃經劫劫皆壞初禪者。
analyzed: 四禪內外過患一切皆無涅槃經劫劫皆壞初禪者。
translated: In the fourth dhyāna, there are no internal or external faults at all. The Nirvāṇa Sūtra says that the first dhyāna is destroyed in every kalpa.
This is because the lifespan in the first dhyāna is one kalpa.
After passing through eight kalpas, the second dhyāna is destroyed.
This is because the lifespan in the second dhyāna is eight kalpas.

original: 次經六十四劫方壞三禪。
analyzed: 次經六十四劫方壞三禪。
translated: After passing through sixty-four kalpas, the third dhyāna is destroyed.

original: 為順三禪六十四劫壽故輔行。
analyzed: 為順三禪六十四劫壽故輔行。
translated: This is because the lifespan in the third dhyāna is sixty-four kalpas.
